'''Brahim Abdelkader Díaz''' ({{langx|ar|إبراهيم عبد القادر دياز}}; born 3 August 1999) is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[attacking midfielder]] or [[right winger|winger]] for [[La Liga]] club [[Real Madrid CF|Real Madrid]]. Born in Spain, he plays for the [[Morocco national football team|Morocco national team]].

==Early life==
Brahim was born in Spain to a Spanish mother and a [[Rifians|Moroccan-Riffian]] father Sufiel Abdelkader Mohand, Brahim grew up in [[Málaga]], but moved to [[Manchester]] aged 16, due to being signed by [[Manchester City F.C. EDS and Academy|Manchester City's youth academy]].<ref>{{citation |title=Abdelkader l'hispano marocain |date=14 December 2017 |url=https://www.africatopsports.com/2017/12/14/abdelkader-diaz-lhispano-marocain-prefere-roja-aux-lions-de-latlas/ |access-date=23 July 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200723135112/https://www.africatopsports.com/2017/12/14/abdelkader-diaz-lhispano-marocain-prefere-roja-aux-lions-de-latlas/ |archive-date=23 July 2020 |url-status=live}}</ref>

==Club career==
===Manchester City===
Brahim began his club career at his hometown club [[Málaga CF|Málaga]], before moving to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in 2015 as a 16-year-old for an initial £200,000 fee.<ref name=MCOP>{{cite web |url=https://www.mancity.com/brahim-diaz |title=Brahim Diaz |publisher=Manchester City F.C. |access-date=28 January 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180126050950/https://www.mancity.com/brahim-diaz |archive-date=26 January 2018 |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Ducker |first=James |title=Manchester City's global scouting mission pays off with 'mind-blowing' talent |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/04/21/manchester-citys-global-scouting-mission-pays-off-with-mind-blow/ |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |date=21 April 2016 |access-date=28 January 2018 |archive-date=23 September 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180923012106/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/04/21/manchester-citys-global-scouting-mission-pays-off-with-mind-blow/ |url-status=live }}</ref> On 21 September 2016, Dí
trending_reason: The Brahim Díaz article might be trending on Wikipedia due to his recent standout performances for both Real Madrid and the Morocco national team, particularly following significant achievements in international competitions.

title: Abdullah_II_of_Jordan
extract: Abdullah II bin Al-Hussein is King of Jordan, having ascended the throne on 7 February 1999. He is a member of the Hashemites, who have been the reigning royal family of Jordan since 1921, and is considered a 41st-generation direct descendant of the Islamic prophet Muhammad.

title: Nancy_Mace
extract: Nancy Ruth Mace is an American politician who has been the U.S. representative for South Carolina's 1st congressional district since 2021. She is a member of the Republican Party.
text:
{{short description|American politician (born 1977)}} {{pp|small=yes}} {{Use mdy dates|date=December 2024}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Nancy Mace | image = Nancy Mace.jpg | state = [[South Carolina]] | district = {{ushr|SC|1|1st}} | term_start = January 3, 2021 | term_end = | predecessor = [[Joe Cunningham (American politician)|Joe Cunningham]] | successor = | state_house1 = South Carolina | district1 = 99th | term_start1 = January 23, 2018 | term_end1 = November 8, 2020 | predecessor1 = [[James Merrill (politician)|James Merrill]] | successor1 = [[Mark Smith (South Carolina politician)|Mark Smith]] | birth_name = Nancy Ruth Mace | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1977|12|4}} | birth_place = [[Fort Liberty|Fort Bragg]], [[North Carolina]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] | spouse = {{marriage|Chris Niemiec|1999|2002|end=divorced}}
{{marriage|Curtis Jackson|2004|2019|end=divorced}} | children = 2 | education = [[Trident Technical College]]
[[The Citadel]] ([[Bachelor of Science|BS]])
[[University of Georgia]] ([[Master of Science|MS]]) | website = {{URL|mace.house.gov|House website}} | caption = Official portrait, 2020 }} '''Nancy Ruth Mace''' (born December 4, 1977) is an American politician who has been the [[United States House of Representatives|U.S. representative]] for [[South Carolina's 1st congressional district]] since 2021. She is a member of the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]]. In 1999, she became the first woman to graduate from the [[Cadet Corps|Corps of Cadets]] program at the [[The Citadel|Citadel Military College of South Carolina]], which was led at the time by her father, Emory Mace, the [[Commandant]] of Cadets.{{Cite web |title=Commandant retiring after 8 years at Citadel |url=https://www.goupstate.com/story/news/2005/01/10/commandant-retiring-after-8-years-at-citadel/29744035007/ |access-date=2025-02-06 |website=Spartanburg Herald Journal |language=en-US}} From 2018 to 2020, she represented the 99th district in the [[South Carolina House of Representatives]], covering [[Hanahan, South Carolina|Hanahan]], northeast [[Mount Pleasant, South Carolina|Mount Pleasant]], and [[Daniel Island]]. In 2020, she was elected to the U.S. House of Representatives, becoming the first Republican woman elected to Congress from South Carolina.{{cite web|first=Angelica|last=Stabile|url=https://www.foxnews.com/politics/13-gop-women-joining-the-house-to-dominate-congressional-elections|title=13 GOP women join the House, dominating congressional elections, making history|website=[[FOX News]]|date=November 9, 2020|access-date=November 23, 2020}} Mace worked for [[Donald Trump]]'s [[Donald Trump 2016 presidential campaign|2016 presidential campaign]],{{Cite web |first=Olivia|last=Beavers|title=The curious case of Nancy Mace |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/10/26/curious-case-of-nancy-mace-517159 |date=October 26, 2021|access-date=May 11, 2022|website=[[Politico]] |language=en}} but strongly condemned his actions surrounding the [[January 6 United States Capitol attack|January 6 U.S. Capitol attack]]. She asserted that Trump's legacy had been "wiped out" and that he should be held "accountable" for his actions. However, she ultimately voted against impeaching him,{{cite news |last1=Byrd |first1=Caitlin |title=Trump demanded loyalty. SC Republican Nancy Mace won't give it to him anymore. |url=https://www.thestate.com/news/politics-government/article248343115.html |access-date=July 11, 2023 |work=The State |date=January 7, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210130070521/https://www.thestate.com/news/politics-government/article248343115.html |archive-date=January 30, 2021}}{{cite news |last1=Feit |first1=Noah |title=After her life was risked, SC's Mace wants Trump held accountable for Capitol riot |url=https://www.thestate.com/news/politics-government/article248570315.html |access-date=July 11, 2023 |work=The State |date=January 17, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210124133747/https://www.thestate.com/news/politics-government/article248570315.html |archive-date=January 24, 2021}} and, in [[2024 United States presidential election|2024]], endorsed him in the [[2024 Republican Party presidential primaries|Republican presidential primary]]. ==Early life, education, and career== Mace was born at [[Fort Liberty]], [[North Carolina]], to [[United States Army]] [[Brigadier general (United States)|brigadie
trending_reason: The Nancy Mace article might be trending on Wikipedia due to her recent statements and actions regarding the 2024 presidential election, particularly her endorsement of Donald Trump amidst ongoing discussions about party dynamics and her unique position as a Republican woman in Congress.

title: Marc_Fogel
extract: Marc Hilliard Fogel is an American schoolteacher who was arrested in August 2021 by Russian authorities for trying to enter Russia with 0.6 ounces (17 g) of medical cannabis. In June 2022, he was sentenced to 14 years in prison. He was released from Russia on February 11, 2025.
text:
{{Short description|American previously detained in Russia (born in 1961)}}

}}
'''Marc Hilliard Fogel''' (born July 28, 1961) is an American [[schoolteacher]] who was arrested in August 2021 by Russian authorities for trying to enter Russia with {{convert|0.6|oz|g}} of [[medical cannabis]]. In June 2022, he was sentenced to 14 years in prison.<ref>{{Cite news|first=Manuel |last=Roig-Franzia |title= This American teacher also sits in a Russian jail, worried nobody cares  |newspaper=The Washington Post|date=July 28, 2022|url= https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/2022/07/28/marc-fogel-teacher-russia-prison/}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2022/12/09/world/europe/americans-detained-russia-whelan-fogel.html|title=Here's a look at two Americans still detained in Russian penal colonies.|first=Valerie|last=Hopkins|work=The New York Times |date=December 9, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/08/26/politics/marc-fogel-russia/index.html|title=US asked Russia to release American Marc Fogel on humanitarian grounds, his family says|first=Kylie|last=Atwood|date=August 26, 2022|website=CNN}}</ref> He was released from Russia on February 11, 2025.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Maher |first=Kit |date=2025-02-11 |title=White House announces wrongfully detained American teacher Marc Fogel released from Russia in an ‘exchange’ |url=https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/11/politics/marc-fogel-released-russia-trump/index.html |access-date=2025-02-11 |website=CNN |language=en}}</ref>

==Life and career==
Fogel is from [[Pennsylvania]], United States. He attended the [[Indiana University of Pennsylvania]].<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.wtae.com/amp/article/marc-fogel-remains-imprisoned-in-russia/42189259 | title=Butler County native Marc Fogel remains imprisoned in Russia after Griner prisoner swap | date=December 8, 2022 }}</ref> He was a history teacher at international schools in [[Colombia]], [[Malaysia]], [[Oman]], [[Mexico]] and [[Venezuela]]. He had lived and worked in Russia since 2012, teaching at the [[Anglo-American School of Moscow]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite magazine |title=Marc Fogel Still in Russia for Marijuana After Griner Freed |url=https://time.com/6240286/marc-fogel-russia-prison-griner/ |access-date=December 16, 2022 |magazine=Time |date=December 10, 2022 |language=en}}</ref>

==Arrest and imprisonment==
In August, 2021, Fogel entered Russia through customs at [[Sheremetyevo Airport]] when 17 grams of [[medical cannabis]] was found in his luggage. The substance had been prescribed to him in the United States to treat chronic pain.<ref name=":0" />

In June, 2022, Fogel was convicted of drug trafficking and sentenced to 14 years in prison. In October 2022, he was transferred from a detention center in Moscow to a [[Corrective labor colony|penal colony]], where he would serve the remainder of his sentence.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2022/12/10/marc-fogel-russia-brittney-griner-00073363|title=The Other American Jailed in Russia on Marijuana Charges|first=Ian|last=Ward|website=Politico|date=December 10, 2022}}</ref>

In August 2022, a bipartisan group of [[United States senator]]s lobbied for the State Department to designate Fogel as wrongfully detained.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/08/23/politics/bipartisan-senators-letter-marc-fogel/index.html | title=Bipartisan group of senators urge State Department to designate American teacher as 'wrongfully detained' in Russia | website=[[CNN]] | date=August 23, 2022 }}</ref>

Fogel's family called on [[Brittney Griner]] (who was imprisoned but [[Viktor Bout–Brittney Griner prisoner exchange|released in a prisoner exchange]] in 2022) to speak out on his case.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/marc-fogel-family-russian-prison-calls-on-brittney-griner-to-speak-out/ | title=Family of American teacher in Russian prison calls on Brittney Griner to speak out for those left behind | website=[[CBS News]] | d
